user.title: Connect to TermoWeb family heaters
user.description: Choose your TermoWeb or Ducaheat brand and enter your account credentials.

set_acm_preset.name: Configure accumulator boost preset
set_acm_preset.description: Update the default boost duration and/or temperature for a TermoWeb accumulator. Minutes must be between 60 and 600 in 60-minute increments; omit a field to keep the existing value.

minutes.name: Default boost duration
minutes.description: Number of minutes the boost should run when no override is provided (60–600, step 60).

temperature.name: Boost temperature
temperature.description: Optional boost setpoint to apply during the boost session (°C or °F).

start_boost.name: Start accumulator boost
start_boost.description: Trigger an immediate boost on a TermoWeb accumulator. Provide a duration to override the default (60–600 minutes in 60-minute increments), or omit it to use the stored preset.

minutes.name: Boost duration
minutes.description: Duration of the boost session in minutes (60–600, step 60). Optional.

cancel_boost.name: Cancel accumulator boost
cancel_boost.description: Cancel the active boost session on a TermoWeb accumulator.

set_schedule.name: Set weekly schedule
set_schedule.description: Set the 7×24 weekly program for a TermoWeb heater. The program is a list of 168 integers, where each value corresponds to one hour of the week starting Monday 00:00. Use 0 for the cold preset, 1 for the night preset and 2 for the day preset.

prog.name: Program
prog.description: A list of 168 integers (0, 1 or 2) representing the heater’s weekly schedule. Index 0 is Monday 00:00, index 1 is Monday 01:00, and so on.

set_preset_temperatures.name: Set preset temperatures
set_preset_temperatures.description: Set the cold, night and day preset temperatures for a TermoWeb heater. You can either provide all three temperatures as a single list (``ptemp``) or specify each one separately (``cold``, ``night`` and ``day``).

ptemp.name: Preset temperatures
ptemp.description: A list of three temperatures [cold, night, day] in the same units as the heater (°C or °F). If provided, this will override individual cold, night and day values.

cold.name: Cold preset
cold.description: Temperature for the cold preset (°C or °F).

night.name: Night preset
night.description: Temperature for the night preset (°C or °F).

day.name: Day preset
day.description: Temperature for the day preset (°C or °F).

import_energy_history.name: Import energy history
import_energy_history.description: Import historical hourly energy counters for TermoWeb heaters up to one year ago into Home Assistant statistics for every configured heater.

reset_progress.name: Reset progress
reset_progress.description: Clear stored progress and re-import history from scratch.

max_history_retrieval.name: Max history days
max_history_retrieval.description: Number of days of history to retrieve. Overrides the configured default for this import only.

ws_debug_probe.name: Emit websocket debug probe
ws_debug_probe.description: Request an immediate ``dev_data`` refresh from the websocket client and log the next ``dev_handshake`` and ``update`` frame sizes. Enable the debug option in the integration settings before using this helper.

entry_id.name: Config entry ID
entry_id.description: Restrict the probe to a single TermoWeb config entry.

dev_id.name: Device ID
dev_id.description: Restrict the probe to a single gateway device.
